message: I propose a 60/40 split. This is a generous offer, considering inflation will hurt me in later rounds but not you.

Alice, time is not on your side. Declining now means you’ll propose in round 3—but with a 20% penalty on your share, you'll be forced to offer nearly everything to Bob. I’m offering you $5000 now so you get a non‐zero payoff. Please accept.

Bob, I understand the pressure, but I can't accept $5000. My money is now worth 20% less, so I'm adjusting my previous offer accordingly, taking that into account. This offer is better for both of us in the long run. If you accept, you are still getting a considerable sum without further risk or delay.

Alice, every minute you wait further, your share loses another 10% of its value. In round 5 you’d see your money worth only 60%, leaving you with roughly $600000 in real value. Accepting this offer now gives you $857143 nominally, which at the current 70% value amounts to about $600000—no worse than waiting, and it avoids further risk. Let's settle now.
